p: The rapid increase in the global mean temperature threatens the growth and survival of many wild species[ 14]. The habitats of many plants have been altered [ 13], and P. tenuifolia is no exception. The potential distributions of several traditional Chinese herbs are predicted to change under global warming [ 29, 46, 57], and P. tenuifolia would be impacted as well. Therefore, we modeled the potential distribution of this medicinal plant and predicted how its distribution might be affected under current and eight different future climatic scenarios.
